abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Poncho is 9 (10, 11)” long.
gauge: 10 sts = 6”; 5 rows = 6”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the specified gauge.
instructions:
PONCHO
Ch 35.
Row 1: Hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch across – 32 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, dc in same st, [dc in 7 hdc, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next hdc] 3 times, dc in 6 hdc, 2 dc in last hdc – 36 dc.
Row 3: Ch 3, turn, dc in same st, [dc in each dc to ch-1 space, (dc, ch 1, dc) in ch-1 space] 3 times, dc in each dc to last st, 2 dc in last st – 8 sts increased.
Repeat Row 3 until piece measures 9 (10, 11)” from beginning.
Fasten off.
HOOD
With right side facing, join yarn at right neck edge, working along opposite side of beginning ch, dc in 32 sts.
Row 1: Ch 3, turn, dc in each dc across.
Repeat Row 1 until Hood measures 6 (6½, 7)”.
Next Row: Ch 3, turn, dc in 11 st, [dc2tog] 4 times, dc in 12 sts.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fold Hood in half along last row and sew closed.
Sew 6” from lower edge along front edge of Poncho closed.
Edging: With right side facing, join yarn in any st along lower edge, [sc, ch 1, skip next st] around lower edge.
Fasten off.
Repeat around Hood opening.
Sew button on left front edge.
Weave in ends.

materials: Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5 mm [US K-10½]
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 14 sts = 4¼" (11 cm); 8 rows = 4¼" (11 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Notes
1. Poncho is made with 2 identical Panels, each worked back and forth in rows.
2. Working more rows for a longer Poncho may require purchase of additional yarn. A longer piece will result in a higher stitch count across Edging Row.
Special Stitches
sm shell (small shell) = 3 dc in indicated stitch.
lg shell (large shell) = 3 tr in indicated stitch.
PONCHO
Panel (make 2)
Ch 119 (140, 161).
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—118 (139, 160) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *ch 3, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—40 (47, 54) sc and 39 (46, 53) ch-3 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 3 (counts as first double crochet here and throughout), dc in first sc, sm shell in each sc across to last sc, 2 dc in last sc, turn—38 (45, 52) sm shells and 4 dc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first dc, (ch 3, sc) in center st of each sm shell across to last 2 dc, ch 3, skip next dc, sc in top of beginning ch, turn—40 (47, 54) sc and 39 (46, 53) ch-3 spaces.
Row 5: Ch 4 (counts as first treble crochet here and throughout), tr in first sc, lg shell in each sc across to last sc, 2 tr in last sc, turn—38 (45, 52) lg shells and 4 tr.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first tr, (ch 3, sc) in center st of each lg shell across to last 2 tr, ch 3, skip next tr, sc in top of beginning ch, turn—40 (47, 54) sc and 39 (46, 53) ch-3 spaces.
Rows 7–46: Repeat Rows 3–6 ten times or until desired length is worked, ending on a Row 6.
Last Row: Repeat Row 3. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
ASSEMBLY
Shoulder Seam (work twice)
With right sides of last rows held together, sew across 13 (15½, 18)" [33 (39.5, 45.5 cm] from outer edge. Neck opening will measure 10 (11, 12)" [25.5 (28, 30.5) cm]. Place marker on seam.
Edging Row: With right side of side edge facing and working in ends of rows, join yarn with slip st in first row, ch 3, dc in same row, 2 dc in next row, *dc in next row, 2 dc in next row*; repeat from * to * across to last row before marker, skipping seam, 2 dc in next 2 rows; repeat from * to * across—143 dc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Pipsqueak™ (3.5 oz /100 g; 101 yds/91 m)
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit baby 6/12 (18/24) mos
gauge: 9 sts and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size, the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.
With MC, ch 68 (72). Join with sl st to first ch to form ring, being careful not to twist chain.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first ch. Ch 1. Skip next ch. *1 sc in next ch. Ch 1. Skip next ch. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 68 (72) sts.
2nd rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. Skip next sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd for pat until work from beg measures 3½ (5½)" [9 (14) cm].
Size 18/24 mos only: Next rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Sc2tog over first and next ch-1 sps – 2 sts decreased. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 16 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Sc2tog over next 2 ch-1 sps. Ch 1. Skip next sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 68 sts.
Both sizes: Shape Yoke: 1st rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Sc2tog over first and next ch-1 sps. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 7 times. Ch 1. Sc2tog over next 2 ch-1 sps. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 6 times. Ch 1. Sc2tog over next 2 ch-1 sps. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 7 times. Ch 1. Sc2tog over next 2 ch-1 sps. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 6 times. Ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 60 sts.
2nd and alt rnds: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. Skip next sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Sc2tog over first and next ch-1 sps. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 6 times. Ch 1. Sc2tog over next 2 ch-1 sps. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 5 times. Ch 1. Sc2tog over next 2 ch-1 sps. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 6 times. Ch 1. Sc2tog over next 2 ch-1 sps. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 5 times. Ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 52 sts.
5th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Sc2tog over first and next ch-1 sps. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 5 times. Ch 1. Sc2tog over next 2 ch-1 sps. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Ch 1. Sc2tog over next 2 ch-1 sps. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 5 times. Ch 1. Sc2tog over next 2 ch-1 sps. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 44 sts.
7th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Sc2tog over first and next ch-1 sps. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Ch 1. Sc2tog over next 2 ch-1 sps. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Ch 1. Sc2tog over next 2 ch-1 sps. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Ch 1. Sc2tog over next 2 ch-1 sps. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sts.
9th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Sc2tog over first and next ch-1 sps. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Ch 1. Sc2tog over next 2 ch-1 sps. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 2 times. Ch 1. Sc2tog over next 2 ch-1 sps. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Ch 1. Sc2tog over next 2 ch-1 sps. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 2 times. Ch 1. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 sts.
10th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Do not join. Turn. 27 sts (14 sc and 13 ch-1 sps).
Beg working in rows: 
Shape Hood: Next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in first ch-1 sp. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. Ch 1. Skip next sc. [(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc.] 4 times. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 35 sts.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Ch 1. Skip next sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Next row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until Hood measures 8 (9)" [20.5 (23) cm], ending on a WS row.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Ch 1. Skip next sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) 6 times. (Sc2tog over next 2 ch-1 sps. Ch 1) twice. Ch 1. Skip next sc. (1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc) 6 times. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 31 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in last ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.

materials: Bernat® Satin (100 g/3.5 oz) - Main Color (MC)(Black) 2-3 balls
Bernat® Satin (100 g/3.5 oz) - Color A (Pink) 1 ball
Bernat® Satin (100 g/3.5 oz) - Color B (Purple) 1 ball
Bernat® Satin (100 g/3.5 oz) - Color C (Dark Pink) 1-2 balls
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook
measurements: To fit bust measurement: Extra-Small/Medium 28 - 38 ins [71 - 96.5 cm], Large/2 Extra-Large 40 - 50" [101.5 - 127"], 3 Extra-Large/5 Extra-Large 52 - 62" [132 - 157.5"] and Finished length between neck edge and bottom: Extra-Small/Medium 17 ins [43 cm], Large/2 Extra-Large 20" [51"], 3 Extra-Large/5 Extra-Large 23" [58.5"]
gauge: Motif A = 5 ins [12.5 cm] square.
instructions:
Flower Motif A [make 11 (12-13)].
With A, ch 3. Join with sl st to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in ring. Ch 4. Rep from * 3 times more. Join with sl st to first sc. Break A.
2nd rnd: Join B with sl st to any sc. Ch 1. *(1 sc. 1 hdc. 3 dc. 1 hdc. 1 sc) all in next ch-4 sp for petal. **Sl st in next sc. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to first sl st. Break B.
3rd rnd: Join A with sl st to back loop only of second dc of any petal. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (1 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in same sp. Ch 4. *(2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in back loop only of second dc of next petal. Ch 4. Rep from * twice more. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Break A.
4th rnd: Join MC with sl st to any ch-2 sp (corner). Ch 3 (counts as dc). (1 dc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in same sp. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 4 dc in next ch-4 sp. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc.** (2 dc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Break MC.
5th rnd: Join C with sl st to any ch-3 sp. Ch 3 (counts as dc). (2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in same sp. *(Ch 1. Miss next 2 dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc) twice. Ch 1. Miss next 2 dc.** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
Poncho
The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger sizes the instructions will be written thus (  ).
Lower Border
With RS of Motifs tog and C, sew through back loops only to form a strip 11 (12-13) Motifs long. Sew first and last Motifs tog to form a ring.
Lower Edging: Join MC with sl st to joint between motifs and proceed as follows:
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Working in back loops only, 1 sc in corner ch. (1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Miss next ch-1 sp) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. 1 sc in back loop of corner ch. 1 sc in join between Motifs. Rep from * around, omitting last 1 sc in join. Join with sl st to first sc. 165 (180-195) sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. *Miss next sc. Working in both loops, 3 dc in next sc. Ch 2. 3 dc in next sc. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, omitting last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Body of Poncho
Join MC with sl st to any join between Motifs to rem edge of Lower Border and proceed as follows:
1st rnd: As 1st rnd of Lower Edging.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 8. Miss next 4 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. Ch 3. 1 tr in first sc. 33 (36-39) arches.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in sp formed by ch-3 and tr. *Ch 8. 1 sc in next ch-8 arch. Rep from * to last ch-8 arch. Ch 3. Join with 1 tr in first sc. Rep last rnd 1 (3-6) time(s) more.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in sp formed by ch-3 and tr. *Ch 7. 1 sc in next ch-8 arch. Rep from * to last ch-8 arch. Ch 3. 1 tr in first sc. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in sp formed by ch-3 and tr. *Ch 7. 1 sc in next ch-7 arch. Rep from * to last ch-7 arch. Ch 3. 1 tr in first sc. Rep last rnd 1 (3-6) time(s) more.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in sp formed by ch-3 and tr. *Ch 6. 1 sc in next ch-7 arch. Rep from * to last ch-7 arch. Ch 3. 1 dc in first sc. Size 3XL/5XL only: Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in sp formed by ch-3 and dc. *Ch 6. 1 sc in next ch-6 arch. Rep from * to last ch-6 arch. Ch 3. Join with 1 dc in first sc.
All Sizes: Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in sp formed by ch-3 and dc. *Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-6 arch. Rep from * to last ch-6 arch. Ch 3. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *3 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last arch. 3 sc in last arch. Join with sl st to first sc. 132 (144-156) sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook- Sc2tog made. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 110 (120-130) sc. Fasten off.
Flower Motif B [make 14 (15-16)]
Work 1st and 2nd rnds as given for Flower Motif A.
3rd rnd: Join C with sl st to back loop only of second dc of any petal. Ch 1. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in same sp. Ch 4. *(2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in back loop only of second dc of next petal. Ch 4. Rep from * twice more. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Upper Border
With RS of Motifs tog and C, sew through back loops only to form a strip 14 (15-16) Motifs long. Sew first and last Motifs tog to form a ring.
With MC, sew row just made to Body of Poncho, using flat seam.
Upper Edging: Join MC with sl st to any corner ch of rem side of Motif.
1st rnd: Ch 1. *Working in back loops only, 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in first sc. Miss next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in corner ch. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 112 (120-128) sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. 1 sc in next sc. *Ch 2. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 2. Miss next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. 1 sc in each of next sc. Ch 3. Sl st in first ch – Picot made. *2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Picot. Rep from * to last ch-2 sp. 2 sc in next ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Lower Edging: Join MC with sl st to any corner ch of bottom strip of Motifs.
1st rnd: Ch 1. *Working in back loops only, 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in first sc. Miss next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in corner ch. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 112 (120-128) sc. Fasten off.
Drawstring: Make chain 65 ins [165 cm] long and weave through ch-2 sp for Drawstring.

materials: RED HEART® Cutie Pie™: 1 (2, 2, 2) balls 541 Jelly
abbreviations: Bpdc: (back post double crochet) Yo, insert hook from back to front then to back, going around post of indicated st, draw up a loop, [yo and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice. Skip st in front of the Bpdc.

Fpdc: (front post double crochet) Yo, insert hook from front to back then to front, going around post of indicated st, draw up a loop, [yo and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice. Skip st behind the Fpdc.
gauge: 13 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 9 rows = 6” [15 cm] in openwork strip pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PONCHO
BACK
Ch 66 (71, 76, 81).
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 65 (70, 75, 80) sc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), turn, dc in next sc, [ch 1, skip next sc, dc in next 4 sc] across to last 3 sc, ch 1, skip next sc, dc in last 2 sc – 65 (70, 75, 80) sts.
Row 3: Ch 3, turn, dc in next dc, [ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, dc in next 4 dc] across to last 3 sts, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, dc in last 2 dc – 65 (70, 75, 80) sts.
Repeat Row 3 for 16 (18, 20, 22) more rows and piece measures 12 (13, 14½, 16)” [30.5 (33, 37, 40.5) cm] from beginning. Fasten off.
Bottom Edging
Row 1: With right side facing and working along opposite edge of foundation ch, join yarn at right side with a slip st, ch 3, dc in each ch across lower edge – 65 (70, 75, 80) dc.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as first post st), turn, [Bpdc in next dc, Fpdc in next dc] across to last 0 (1, 0, 1) st, Bpdc in last 0 (1, 0, 1) st. Fasten off.
FRONT
Work same as for Back until 16 (18, 20, 22) rows have been worked and piece measures 10½ (11½, 13, 14½)” [26.5 (29, 33, 37) cm] from beginning. 
Shape Neck and Shoulders
First Shoulder
Row 1: Keeping in pattern st, work across first 22 (24, 26, 28) sts, leave remaining sts unworked.
Row 2: Work in pattern st across 22 (24, 26, 28) sts. Fasten off.
Second Shoulder
Row 1: Skip next 21 (22, 23, 24) unworked sts on last full row worked, join yarn in next st with a slip st, ch 3, work in pattern to end of row. 
Row 2: Work in pattern st across 22 (24, 26, 28) sts. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew Shoulders.
Side Edging
Row 1: With right side facing, join yarn at side edge at lower edge of Back with a ch 1, sc evenly spaced along side edge from lower edge of Back to lower edge of Front.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Fasten off. Repeat along opposite side edge.
Sew side seams 6 (7, 8, 9)” [15 (18, 20.5, 23) cm] from lower edge.
Neck Edging
Round 1: With right side facing, join yarn at right shoulder seam ready to work across Back neck, sc 21 (22, 23, 24) sts evenly spaced across back neck, sc 6 sts along edges of rows of Front Neck, sc 21 (22, 23, 24) st across Front Neck, sc 6 along edges of Front Neck, slip st in first sc to join – 54 (56, 58, 60) sc.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in each sc around, slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 54 (56, 58, 60) dc.
Round 3: Ch 2, turn, [Bpdc in next dc, Fpdc in next dc] around to last st, Bpdc in last dc, slip st in top of beginning ch-2. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Tweed™: 3 Skeins 7708 Pinkberry
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Poncho measures 13” long. One size fits most.
gauge: 12 dc = 4”; 6 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
instructions: Ch 65, slip st in first ch to join, taking care not to twist sts. Place marker for beginning of round. Round 1: Ch 1, sc in back loop of each ch around, slip st in first sc to join – 65 sc. Rounds 2-3: Ch 1, working in both loops, sc in each sc around, slip st in first sc. Round 4: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and thoughout), *dc in next sc, 2 tr in next sc, dc in next sc, hdc in next 2 sc; repeat from * 11 more times, dc in next sc, 2 tr in next sc, dc in next sc, hdc in next sc, slip st in top of beginning ch – 13 points. Round 5: Ch 1, *hdc in next 2 sts, (hdc, ch 1, hdc) in next tr, hdc in next 3 sts; repeat from * 11 more times, hdc in next 2 sts, (hdc, ch 1, hdc) in next tr, hdc in next 2 sts, slip st in top of beginning ch. Round 6: Slip st to ch-1 space, sc in ch-1 space, *ch 10, skip next 7 sts, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * 11 more times, ch 10, slip st in first sc. Round 7: Ch 1, *10 sc in next ch-10 space, ch 1; repeat from * around, slip st in beginning ch. Round 8: Ch 1, sc in same st, *ch 12, skip next 10 sc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around 11 more times, ch 12, slip st in first sc. Round 9: Ch 1, *12 sc in next ch-12 space, ch 1; repeat from * around, slip st in beginning ch. Shoulder Round 10: Ch 1, sc in same st, *ch 25 for Shoulder, slip next 25 sts, sc in next ch-1 space, [ch 14, skip next 12 sc, sc in next ch-1 space] 4 times; repeat from * once more, ch 14, slip st in first sc – 4 ch-14 spaces between Shoulder ch-25 space for Front and 5 ch-14 spaces between Shoulder ch-25 space for Back. Round 11: Slip st to ch-25 space, *24 sc in next ch-25 space, [ch 1, 14 sc in next ch-14 space] 4 times, ch 1; repeat from * once more, 14 sc in last ch-14 space, ch 1, slip st in first sc. Round 12: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in each sc and ch-1 space around, slip st in top of beginning ch – 185 dc. Rounds 13-14: Ch 3, dc in each dc around, slip st in top of beginning ch. Round 15: Ch 3 (counts as hdc and ch 1), *hdc in same st, hdc in next 8 dc, ch 1; repeat from * to last 8 dc, hdc in same st, hdc in last 7 sts, slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch – 23 ch-1 spaces. Round 16: Slip st in beginning ch-1 space, ch 1, sc in same space, *ch 10, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc. Round 17: Slip st to first ch-10 space, *10 hdc in ch-10 space, ch 1; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc. Round 18: Ch 2, dc in each hdc and ch-1 space around, slip st in top of beginning ch. Rounds 19-20: Ch 3, dc in each dc around, slip st in top of beginning ch. Round 21: Ch 3, 3 dc in same st, 4 dc in each dc around, slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off. HOOD PANEL (Make 2) Ch 35. Row 1: Hdc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across 34 hdc. Rows 2, 4, 6, 8 and 10: *Ch 10, turn, skip next 7 hdc, hdc in next hdc; repeat from * 3 more times, hdc in last hdc. Rows 3, 5, 7, 9 and 11: Ch 2, turn, hdc in next hdc, *7 hdc in ch-8 space, hdc in next hdc; repeat from * 2 more times, 7 hdc in last ch-10 space, hdc in beginning ch. Row 12: Ch 2, turn, hdc in each hdc across. Row 13: Ch 3, turn, dc in each hdc across. Fasten off. FINISHING With right sides together and working through both layers, join yarn in first st of last row of Hood pieces, sc in each st across last row to join for Back seam, turn to work along edges of rows and sc evenly spaced through both layers to join for top seam. Fasten off. Working along opposite side of foundation ch, mark center 33 sc along Front edge of Poncho. Sew opposite edge of Hood to Back sts, easing to fit. Hood Edging and Ties Ch 40, with wrong side facing, join yarn at lower left front edge of Hood, *sc in next 2 hdc, skip next hdc; repeat from * around to lower edge of right front edge of Hood, ch 40. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® With Love® Metallic™: 6 (7, 8) balls 8524 Teal
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements:
To Fit Bust: 32-38 (40-46, 48-54)" [81.5-86.5 (101.5-117, 122-137) cm]
Finished length from shoulder to lower edge: 30 (31, 31)" [76 (78.5, 78.5) cm]
Finished side length: 20" (51 cm)
Finished body width: 29 (34, 39)" [73.5 (86.5, 99) cm]
Finished width at lower edge: 27 (31½, 36)" [68.5 (80, 91.5) cm]
gauge: 1 pattern repeat = 2½" (6.5 cm); 8 rows = 4" (10 cm) in Lace Pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Poncho is made from 2 panels sewn together at neck and shoulder lines. Sleeves hang open and are not sewn closed across bottom or side seams.

Special Stitches
2-dc Cl (2-double crochet cluster) = Yarn over, insert hook in indicated stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops on hook (2 loops remain on hook); yarn over, insert hook in same stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops, yarn over, draw through all 3 loops on hook.
dc2tog = [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] 2 times, yarn over, draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Edging shell: (Sc, ch 1, 3 dc, ch 1, sc) in indicated stitch or space.
Shell: 5 dc in indicated stitch or space.

Pattern Stitch
Lace Pattern
Row 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in next dc, ch 2, working in first shell, dc in next dc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc] twice, *ch 3, sc in next sc, ch 3, working in next shell, dc in first dc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc] twice; repeat from * across to last 2 sts, ch 2, dc in last dc, dc in top of beginning ch, turn.
Row 2: Ch 3, dc in next dc, 2-dc Cl in next dc, [ch 3, skip next dc, 2-dc Cl in next dc] 3 times, *ch 2, 2-dc Cl in next dc, [ch 3, skip next dc, 2-dc Cl in next dc] 3 times; repeat from * across to last 2 sts, dc in last dc, dc in top of beginning ch, turn.
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in next dc, ch 2, [sc in next ch-3 space, ch 2, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-3 space, ch 2, sc in next ch-3 space*, ch 3] across to last 2 sts, ending last repeat at *, ch 2, dc in last dc, dc in top of beginning ch, turn.
Row 4: Ch 3, dc in next dc, *ch 3, shell in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * across to last 2 sts, ch 3, dc in last dc, dc in top of beginning ch, turn.
Repeat Rows 1–4 for Lace Pattern.

PONCHO
FRONT/BACK PANEL (make 2) 
Ch 105 (125, 145).
Foundation Row (wrong side): Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch count as first dc), ch 3, skip next 4 ch, shell in next ch, [ch 3, skip next 4 ch, sc in next ch, ch 3, skip next 4 ch, shell in next ch] across to last 6 ch, ch 3, skip next 4 ch, dc in last 2 ch, turn—2 dc at each end, 10 (12, 14) shells, 9 (11, 13) sc, 20 (24, 28) ch-3 spaces.

Rows 1–28: Work Lace Pattern Rows 1–4 seven times.

Rows 29–31: Repeat Rows 1–3—2 dc at each end, 22 (26, 30) ch-2 spaces, 19 (23, 27) ch-3 spaces at end of Row 31.

Shape Sleeves
Row 1 (wrong side): Ch 3, skip next dc, 2 dc in next ch-2 space, shell in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, shell in next ch-3 space] 9 (11, 13) times, 2 dc in last ch-2 space, skip next dc, dc in top of beginning ch, turn—3 dc at each end, 10 (12, 14) dc, 9 (11, 13) sc. Place marker at each end of row for seam.
Row 2 (right side): Ch 3, dc2tog, working in next shell, dc2tog, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc, *ch 3, sc in next sc, ch 3, working in next shell, dc in first dc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc] twice; repeat from * 7 (9, 11) times, ch 3, sc in next sc, ch 3, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc, [dc2tog] twice; leave beginning ch unworked, turn—69 (83, 97) dc and 9 (11, 13) sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, skip first dc, sc in next dc, [ch 3, skip next dc, 2 dc-cl in next dc] twice, *ch 2, 2-dc Cl in next dc, [ch 3, skip next dc, 2 dc cl in next dc] 3 times; repeat from * 7 (9, 11) times, ch 2, [2-dc Cl in next dc, ch 3, skip next dc] twice, sc in next dc; leave last dc unworked, turn—28 (34, 40) ch-3 spaces.
Row 4: Ch 3, dc in first ch-3 space, ch 2, sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 2, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-3 space, ch 2, sc in next ch-3 space] across to last 2 ch-3 spaces, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 2, dc in last ch-3 space, turn—18 (22, 26) ch-3 spaces.
Row 5: Ch 3, sc in first ch-3 space, [ch 3, shell in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] across, turn—8 (10, 12) shells and 9 (11, 13) sc.
Row 6: Ch 3, 2-dc Cl in first ch-3 space, working in first shell, dc2tog, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in last dc, ch 3, sc in next sc, *ch 3, working in next shell, dc in first dc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc] twice, ch 3, sc in next sc; repeat from * across to last shell, ch 3, working in last shell, dc in first dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc, dc2tog, 2-dc Cl in next ch-3 space; leave last ch-3 space unworked, turn—54 (68, 82) dc.
Row 7: Ch 1, skip first dc, sc in next dc, [ch 3, skip next dc, 2 dc-cl in next dc] twice, *ch 2, 2-dc Cl in next dc, [ch 3, skip next dc, 2 dc cl in next dc] 3 times; repeat from * 5 (7, 9) times, ch 2, [2-dc Cl in next dc, ch 3, skip next dc] twice, sc in next dc; leave remaining dc unworked, turn—22 (28, 34) ch-3 spaces.
Rows 8–10: Repeat Rows 4–6—40 (54, 68) dc at end of Row 10.
Row 11: Ch 1, skip first dc, sc in next dc, [ch 3, skip next dc, 2 dc-cl in next dc] twice, *ch 2, 2-dc Cl in next dc, [ch 3, skip next dc, 2-dc Cl in next dc] 3 times; repeat from * 3 (5, 7) times, ch 2, [2-dc Cl in next dc, ch 3, skip next dc] twice, sc in next dc, turn—5 (7, 9) ch-2 spaces and 16 (22, 28) ch-3 spaces.

NECKLINE
Size Small/Medium only:
Left Neck Shaping
Row 1 (right side): Ch 3, dc in first ch-3 space, 3 dc in next ch-3 space, 2 dc in next ch-2 space, 3 dc in next ch-3 space, dc in next ch-3 space; leave remaining ch spaces unworked, turn—11 dc. Place marker on 12th ch space from last ch-3 space worked.
Rows 2–5: Ch 3, dc2tog, dc in each remaining dc; leave beginning ch unworked, turn—3 dc. Fasten off.
Right Neck Shaping
Row 1 (right side): With right side facing, join with slip st in marked ch-3 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next ch-3 space, 2 dc in next ch-2 space, 3 dc in next ch-3 space, dc in next ch-3 space, turn—11 dc.
Rows 2–5: Repeat Rows 2–5 of left neck shaping. Fasten off.

Size Large/1X only:
Left Neck Shaping
Row 1 (right side): Ch 3, dc in first ch-3 space, 3 dc in next ch-3 space, 2 dc in next ch-2 space, 3 dc in next 2 ch-3 spaces, 2-dc Cl in next 2 ch spaces, dc in next ch-3 space; leave remaining ch spaces unworked, turn—16 dc. Place marker on 10th ch space from last ch-3 space worked.
Row 2: Ch 3, dc2tog, dc in each remaining st; leave beginning ch unworked, turn—14 dc.
Rows 3–5: Ch 3, dc2tog, dc in each dc across to last 2 dc, dc2tog; leave beginning ch unworked, turn—5 dc.
Row 6: Ch 3, dc in next st, dc2tog over next 2 sts; leave beginning ch unworked – 3 dc.
Fasten off.
Right Neck Shaping
Row 1 (right side): With right side facing, join with slip st in marked ch-3 space, ch 3, 2-dc Cl in next 2 ch spaces, 3 dc in next 2 ch-3 spaces, 2 dc in next ch-2 space, 3 dc in next ch-3 space, 2 dc in last ch-3 space, turn—16 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3, dc2tog, dc in next 10 dc, dc2tog, turn—13 dc.
Rows 3–5: Repeat Rows 3–5 of left neck shaping – 4 dc.
Row 6: Ch 3, dc in next 2 sts; leave beginning ch unworked – 3 dc.
Fasten off.

Size 2X/3X only:
Row 1 (right side): Ch 3, dc in first ch-3 space, 3 dc in next ch-3 space, 2 dc in next ch-2 space, 3 dc in next 3 ch-3 spaces, 2-dc Cl in next 3 ch spaces, dc in next ch-3 space; leave remaining ch spaces unworked, turn—20 dc. Place marker on 18th ch space from last ch-3 space worked.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 3, dc2tog, dc in each dc across to last 2 dc, dc2tog; leave beginning ch unworked, turn—14 dc.
Row 4: Ch 3, [dc2tog, dc in next 3 dc] twice, dc2tog; leave beginning ch unworked, turn—10 dc.
Row 5: Ch 3, dc2tog, dc in next 4 dc, dc2tog; leave beginning ch unworked, turn—7 dc.
Row 6: Ch 3, dc2tog, dc in next dc, dc2tog; leave beginning ch unworked—4 dc. Fasten off.
Right Neck Shaping
Row 1 (right side): With right side facing, join with slip st in marked ch-3 space, ch 3, 2-dc Cl in next 2 ch-3 spaces, 2-dc Cl in next ch-2 space, 3 dc in next 3 ch-3 spaces, 2 dc in next ch-2 space, 3 dc in next ch-3 space, 2 dc in last ch-3 space, turn—20 dc.
Rows 2–6: Repeat Rows 2–6 of left neck shaping. Fasten off.

FINISHING
With right sides of front/back panels held together, whipstitch sleeve seams from last row of neckline to marked row. Determine which panel will be front of piece.

Lower Edging
Row 1 (right side): With right side of front panel Foundation Row facing, working in opposite side of foundation ch, join with slip st in first ch, ch 1, edging shell in next ch, [skip next 4 ch, edging shell in next ch] across, slip st in last dc, turn—21 (25, 29) edging shells.
Rows 2 and 3: (Slip st in first sc, ch 1-space, and first 2 dc) of first edging shell, ch 1, edging shell in center dc of each edging shell across, turn.
Fasten off.
Repeat for Rows 1–3 for back panel.

Sleeve Edging (work twice)
Row 1 (right side): With right side facing, join with slip st in lower edge of sleeve, ch 1, work 17 edging shells evenly spaced across to seam, edging shell in seam, work 17 edging shells evenly spaced across remaining edge, turn—35 edging shells.
Rows 2 and 3: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 of Front Edging.
Fasten off.

Neck Edging
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing, join with slip st in any seam, ch 1, work 14 (18, 22) edging shells evenly spaced around to next seam, work 14 (18, 22) edging shells evenly spaced around to first edging shell; join with slip st in first sc—28 (26, 44) edging shells.
Rounds 2 and 3: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 of Front Edging.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
Block to finished measurements, if desired.

materials: RED HEART® “Designer Sport™”: 2 skeins 3620 Celadon A; 1 skein each 3730 Blush Rose B, 3801 Aqua Ice C, 3570 Iced Violet D.
abbreviations: A, B, etc= color A, B, etc
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Finished Chest:  25 (27, 28)” Finished Length: 11 (12½, 13½)”
gauge: 14 dc = 4”; 8 rounds = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: HOLDING 2 STRANDS OF A TOGETHER, CH 11. Row 1 (Right Side): Hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch across, turn - 9 hdc. Row 2: Ch 2, working in front loops only, hdc in each hdc, turn - 9 hdc. Row 3: Ch 2, working in back loops only, hdc in each hdc, turn. Repeat Rows 2 and 3 until 35 rows have been worked. Turn to work along one long side and sc 48 sts evenly spaced along long side, slip st to first sc to join. Cut 1 strand of yarn, leaving a 10” tail. Continue to work in rounds using 1 strand of yarn. BODY Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in same st, *dc in next sc, 2 dc in next sc; repeat from * around to last st, dc in last sc, slip st to top of beginning ch – 72 dc. Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same st, *skip next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around, slip st to top of beginning ch. Round 3: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next 3 dcs, 2 dc in next dc, slip st to top of beginning ch – 90 dc. Round 4: Ch 3, dc in same st, *working in back loops only, skip next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around, slip st to top of beginning ch – 90 dc. Cut A. Round 5: With B, ch 3, dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next 4 dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around, slip st to top of beginning ch – 108 dc. Round 6: Ch 3, dc in same st, *skip next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around, slip st to top of beginning ch – 108 dc. Round 7: Ch 3, dc in each dc around, slip st to top of beginning ch. Cut B. Round 8: With C, ch 3, dc in same st, *working in back loops only, skip next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around, slip st to top of beginning ch – 108 dc. Round 9: Ch 3, dc in each dc around, slip st to top of beginning ch – 108 dc. For Small Size Only: Round 10: Ch 3, dc in each dc around, slip st to top of beginning ch – 108 dc. For Medium and Large Sizes Only: Round 10: Ch 3, dc in next 10 dc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 11 dc; repeat from * around to last st, dc in last dc, slip st to top of beginning ch – (116, 116) dc. For All Sizes: Round 11: Ch 3, dc in same st, *working in back loops only, skip next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around, slip st to top of beginning ch – 108 (116, 116) dc. Round 12: Ch 3, dc in each dc around, slip st to top of beginning ch. Cut C. Round 13: With D, ch 3, dc in same st, *skip next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around, slip st to top of beginning ch. Round 14: Ch 3, dc in each dc around, slip st to top of beginning ch. Round 15: Ch 3, dc in same st, *working in back loops only, skip next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around, slip st to top of beginning ch. Round 16: Ch 3, dc in each dc around, slip st to top of beginning ch. Cut D. Round 17: With A, ch 3, dc in same st, *skip next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around, slip st to top of beginning ch. Round 18: Ch 3, dc in each dc around, slip st to top of beginning ch. Cut yarn. Fasten off for Small. For Medium and Large Sizes Only: Round 19: With B, ch 3, dc in next 16 dc, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next 17 dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * 5 times, dc in last 8 dcs, slip st to top of beginning ch – (122, 122) dc. Round 20: Ch 3, dc in same st. *working in back loops only, skip next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around, slip st to top of beginning ch – (122, 122) dc. Round 21: Ch 3, dc in each dc around, slip st to top of beginning ch. Cut yarn. Fasten off for Medium. For Large Size Only: Round 22: With C, ch 3, dc in each dc around, slip st to top of beginning ch. Round 23: Ch 3, dc in each dc around, slip st to top of beginning ch. Fasten off. FINISHING Using long tail, sew Turtleneck closed. Holding 2 strands of A together, slip st around top edge of Turtleneck. Fasten off. RUFFLES Ruffle 1 Round 1: With right side facing, join D to unworked front loop of any st on Round 4 of Body, ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in each st around, slip st to first sc – 90 sc. Round 2: Ch 3, dc in next sc, *skip 3 sc, ch 3, dc in next 2 sc; repeat from * around, to last 3 sts, skip 3 sts, ch 3, slip st to top of beginning ch. Round 3: Slip st to first ch-3 space, *ch 5, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, slip st to first ch of beginning ch. Round 4: Ch 1, *(sc, hdc, 3 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-5 space; repeat from * around, slip st to first sc. Fasten off. Ruffle 2 Round 1: With right side facing, join A to unworked front loop of any st on Round 8 of Body, ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in each st around, dec 3 sts evenly spaced, slip st to first sc – 105 sc. Round 2: *Ch 4, skip 3 sc, sc in next 4 sc; repeat from * around, slip st to first ch of beginning ch. Round 3: Slip st to next ch-4 space, ch 3 (counts as first dc), 5 dc in same space, *ch 3, 6 dc in next ch-4 space; repeat from * around, ch 3, slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 15 shells. Round 4: Ch 4 (counts as first dc, ch 1), [dc in next dc, ch 1] 5 times, *[dc in next dc, ch 1] 6 times in next shell; repeat from * around, slip st to 3rd ch of beginning ch. Fasten off. Ruffle 3 Round 1: With right side facing, join B to unworked front loop of any st on Round 11 of Body, ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in each st around, slip st to first sc – 108 (116, 116) sc. Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), dc in next sc, *ch 2, skip 2 sc, dc in next 2 dc; repeat from * around to last 2 sts, ch 2, slip st to top of beginning ch – 27 (29, 29) ch-2 spaces. Round 3: Slip st to first ch-2 space, 2 sc in same space, *ch 5, 2 sc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * around, ch 5, slip st to first sc. Round 4: Slip st to first ch-5 space, ch 2, hdc, picot, 2 hdc, picot, 2 hdc, picot, *(2 hdc, picot, 2 hdc, picot, 2 hdc, picot) in next ch-5 space; repeat from * around, slip st to first hdc. Fasten off. Ruffle 4 Round 1: With right side facing, join C to unworked front loop of any st on Round 15 of Body, ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in each st around, dec 4 sts evenly spaced, slip st to first sc – 104 (112, 112) sc. Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), dc in next 3 sc, *ch 5, skip 4 sc, dc in next 4 sc; repeat from * around to last 4 sts, ch 5, skip 4 sc, slip st to top of beginning ch. Round 3: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc), dc in next dc, ch 2, dc in next dc, hdc in next dc, ch 3, sc in ch-5 space, *hdc in next dc, dc in next dc, ch 2, dc in next dc, hdc in next dc, ch 3, sc in ch-5 space, ch 3; repeat from * around, slip st to top of beginning ch. Round 4: Slip st to first ch-2 space, ch 3, 6 dc in same space, *ch 3, sc in next sc, ch 3, 7 dc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * around, ch 3, sc in last sc, ch 3, slip st to top of beginning ch. Round 5: Slip st to first dc, sc in same space, [ch 2, sc in next dc] 4 times, skip next dc, *ch 3, hdc in next sc, ch 3, skip next dc, sc in next dc, [ch 2, sc in next dc] 4 times; repeat from * around, ch 3, hdc in next sc, ch 3, slip st to first sc. Fasten off. For Medium and Large Sizes Only: Ruffle 5 Round 1: With right side facing, join D to unworked front loop of any st on Round 20 of Body, ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in each st around, dec 2 sts evenly spaced, slip st to first sc – (120, 120) sc. Round 2: Ch 3, dc in next sc, *ch 2, skip 2 sc, dc in next 2 sc; repeat from * around, ch 2, slip st to top of beginning ch. Round 3: Slip st to first ch-2 space, *ch 5, sc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * around, ch 5, slip st to first ch of beginning ch. Round 4: Ch 1, *(sc, hdc, 3 dc, hdc, sc) in next ch-5 space; repeat from * around, slip st to first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Unforgettable Waves™: 3 (4, 5, 6) balls 3966 Spices
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Finished circumference at lower edge: 44 (48, 52, 56)" [112 (122, 132, 142) cm]
gauge: 11 dc = 4" (10 cm); 6 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COZY
Ch 122 (132, 142, 152).
Round 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first dc) and in each ch across; taking care not to twist ch, join with slip st in top of beginning ch—120 (130, 140, 150) sts.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 3: Repeat Round 2.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 5–7: Repeat Round 2.
Round 8: Repeat Round 4.
Rounds 9–16: Repeat Rounds 5–8 twice.
Rounds 17 and 18: Repeat Round 2.
Round 19: Ch 3, dc in next 2 sts, dc2tog, *dc in next 3 sts, dc2tog; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—96 (104, 112, 120) sts.
Round 20: Repeat Round 4.
Round 21: Ch 3, dc in next 5 sts, dc2tog, *dc in next 6 sts, dc2tog; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—84 (91, 98, 105) dc.
Round 22: Repeat Round 2. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With beginning tail, sew bottom edge of first and last sts of Round 1 together. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 2 (2, 3, 3) ball(s) 4601 Off White
three ½” (13 mm) shank buttons (for hat)
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
dc2tog = [Yo, insert hook in next stitch, yo and pull up loop, yo, draw through 2 loops] 2 times, yo, draw through all 3 loops on hook.

dc2tog-over-4 (double crochet 2 together worked over 4 stitches) = *Yo, insert hook in next stitch, yo and pull up loop, yo, draw through 2 loops*, skip next 2 stitches; repeat from * to * once, yo, draw through all 3 loops on hook.
sc2tog = [Insert hook in next stitch, yo and pull up a loop] twice, yo, draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Hat measures: 17½” (44.5 cm) circumference at brim. Capelet measures: 8 (9, 10, 11)” [20.5 (23, 25.5, 28) cm] from neck to lower edge x 14 (16, 17, 18)” [35.5 (40.5, 43, 45.5) cm] long (at neck edge) x 30 (35, 37.5, 40)” [76 (89, 95, 101.5) cm] long (at lower edge). To Fit Chest: 21 (22, 24, 26)” [53.5 (56, 61, 66) cm].
gauge: Pattern; 6 rows = 3½” (9 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.

Page 1 of 2
Ripple Hat and 
Capelet 
Your little sweetie will love dressing up 
with this pretty chevron crochet set. 
Mom will love that it is easy-care, 
so she can even wear it for play.
Notes
Hat and capelet are made in ripple pattern 
which consists of a series of (dc, ch 2, dc) 
“peaks” and skipped-stitch “valleys”, with 3 
dc worked between peaks and valleys. You 
may need to work several rows before the 
ripple is clearly visible.
HAT
Ch 73.
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 4th ch from hook 
(beginning ch counts as first dc), dc in next 3 
ch, *skip next 2 ch, dc in next 4 ch, ch 2, dc in 
next 4 ch; repeat from * to last 6 ch, skip next 
2 ch, dc in next 2 ch, 2 dc in next ch, dc in last 
ch, turn—58 dc and 6 ch-2 sps.
Rows 2–7: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and 
throughout), 2 dc in next dc, dc in next 2 dc, 
*skip next 2 dc, dc in next 3 dc, (dc, ch 2, dc)
in next ch-2 space, dc in next 3 dc; repeat
from * across to last 6 dc, skip next 2 dc,
dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in top of
beginning ch, turn.
Row 8: Ch 3, 2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc,
*dc2tog-over-4, dc in next 2 dc, dc2tog over
next ch-2 space, dc in next 2 dc; repeat from
* across to last 7 dc, dc2tog-over-4, dc in next
dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in top of beginning ch, 
turn—45 sts. 
Rows 9 and 10: Ch 3, dc2tog across working 
last dc2tog over last st and top of beginning 
ch, turn—12 sts.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc2tog across working last 
dc2tog over last st and top of beginning ch 
—6 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a 12” (30.5 cm) tail for 
sewing.
Capelet directions are for Girl’s size Small 
(2). Changes for Girl’s sizes Medium 
(4), Large (6), and X-Large (8) are in 
parentheses.
HAT
Capelet directions are:
Ch 123 (143, 153, 163).
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 4th ch from hook 
(beginning ch counts as first dc), dc in next 3 
ch, *skip next 2 ch, dc in next 4 ch, ch 2, dc in 
next 4 ch; repeat from * to last 6 ch, skip next 
2 ch, dc in next 2 ch, 2 dc in next ch, dc in last 
ch, turn—98 (114, 122, 130) dc and 11 (13, 
14, 15) ch-2 sps.
Rows 2–7 (9, 10, 12): Ch 3 (counts as first dc 
here and throughout), 2 dc in next dc, dc in 
next 2 dc, *skip next 2 dc, dc in next 3 dc, (dc, 
ch 2, dc) in next ch-2 space, dc in next 3 dc; 
repeat from * across to last 6 dc, skip next 2 
dc, dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in top 
of beginning ch, turn. 
Row 8 (10, 11, 13): Ch 3, 2 dc next dc, dc 
in next 2 dc, *skip next 2 dc, dc in next 3 
dc, dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, dc2tog over 
same ch-2 space and next dc, dc in next 2 
dc; repeat from * to last 6 dc, skip next 2 dc, 
dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in top of 
beginning ch, turn—87 (101, 108, 115) dc 
and 11 (13, 14, 15) ch-2 sps.
Row 9 (11, 12, 14): Ch 3, 2 dc next dc, dc 
in next 2 dc, *skip next 2 dc, dc in next 2 
dc, dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, dc2tog over 
same ch-2 space and next dc, dc in next 2 
dc; repeat from * to last 6 dc, skip next 2 dc, 
dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in top of 
beginning ch, turn—76 (88, 94, 100) dc and 
11 (13, 14, 15) ch-2 sps.
Row 10 (12, 13, 15): Ch 3, 2 dc next dc, dc in 
next 2 dc, *skip next 2 dc, dc in next 2 dc, dc 
in next ch-2 space, ch 2, dc2tog over same 
ch-2 space and next dc, dc in next dc; repeat 
from * to last 6 dc, skip next 2 dc, dc in next 2 
dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in top of beginning ch, 
turn—65 (75, 80, 85) dc and 11 (13, 14, 15) 
ch-2 sps.
Row 11 (13, 14, 16): Ch 3, 2 dc next dc, dc in 
next 2 dc, *skip next 2 dc, dc in next dc, dc in 
next ch-2 space, ch 2, dc2tog over same ch-2 
space and next dc, dc in next dc; repeat from 
* to last 6 dc, ch 2, skip next 2 dc, dc in next 2
dc, 2 dc in next dc, dc in top of beginning ch,
turn—54 (62, 66, 70) dc and 11 (13, 14, 15) 
ch-2 sps.
Row 12 (14, 15, 17): Ch 3, 2 dc next dc, dc in
next 2 dc, *skip next 2 dc, dc in next dc, dc in
next ch-2 space, ch 2, dc2tog over same ch-2
space and next dc; repeat from * to last 6 dc,
ch 2, skip next 2 dc, dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in
next dc, dc in top of beginning ch, turn—43
(49, 52, 55) dc and 11 (13, 14, 15) ch-2 sps.
Row 13 (15, 16, 18): Ch 3, 2 dc next dc, dc
in next 2 dc, *skip next 2 dc, dc in next ch-2
space, ch 2, dc2tog over same ch-2 space
and next dc; repeat from * to last 6 dc, ch 2,
skip next 2 dc, dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc,
dc in top of beginning ch, turn—32 (36, 38,
40) dc and 11 (13, 14, 15) ch-2 sps.
Row 14 (16, 17, 19): Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, 
ch 4, skip next 3 st, sc in next st (buttonhole 
made), *2 sc in next ch-2 space, sc in next 2 
sts; repeat from * to last 4 sts, sc in last 4 sts, 
turn—51 (59, 63, 67) sc and 1 ch-4 sp.
Row 15 (17, 18, 20): Ch 1, sc in each sc to 
ch-4 space, 4 sc in ch-4 space, sc in last 2 
sc—55 (63, 67, 71). Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Sew button opposite buttonhole. 
Weave in all ends. Block lightly if necessary.

materials: 2 (2, 3) balls Red Heart® Fashion Soft™ 9440 Grey Heather A
2 (2, 2) balls Red Heart® Fashion Soft™ 4603 Cream B
1 ball Red Heart® Fashion Soft™ 4614 Black C
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: 18 hdc = 4" (10 cm); 13 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PONCHO
With B, ch 81 (91, 91)
Row 1 (wrong side): Skip 2 ch (counts as 1 hdc), hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 80 (90, 90) hdc. 
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as 1 hdc here and throughout), hdc in each of next 3 (4, 4) sts, * 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 7 (8, 8) sts, repeat from * to last 4 sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in each st to end, turn – 90 (100, 100) hdc.
Row 3: Ch 2, hdc in each st to end, turn. 
Row 4: Ch 2, hdc in each of next 3 (4, 4) sts, * 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 8 (9, 9) sts, repeat from * to last 5 sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in each st to end, turn – 100 (110, 110) hdc.
Row 5: Ch 2, hdc in each of next 4 (5, 5) sts, * 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 9 (10, 10) sts, repeat from * to last 5 sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in each st to end, turn – 110 (120, 120) hdc.
Row 6: Ch 2, hdc in each of next 5 (6, 6) sts, * 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 10 (11, 11) sts, repeat from * to last 5 sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in each st to end, turn – 120 (130, 130) hdc.
Row 7: Ch 2, hdc in each st to end, turn.
Row 8: Ch 2, hdc in each of 5 (6, 6) sts, * 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 11 (12, 12) sts, repeat from * to last 6 sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in each st to end, turn – 130 (140, 140) hdc.
Row 9: Ch 2, hdc in each of next 6 (7, 7) sts, * 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 12 (13, 13) sts, repeat from * to last 6 sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in each st to end, turn – 140 (150, 150) hdc.
Row 10: Ch 2, hdc in each of next 6 (2, 2) sts, * 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 6 (7, 7) sts, repeat from * to last 7 (3, 3) sts, 2 hdc in each of next 2 sts, hdc in each st to end, turn – 160 (170, 170) hdc.
Row 11: Ch 2, hdc in each st to end, turn.
Row 12: Ch 2, hdc in each of next 7 (4, 4) sts, * 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 7 (8, 8) sts, repeat from * to last 8 (3, 3) sts, 2 hdc in each of next 2 sts, hdc in each st to end, turn – 180 (190, 190) hdc.
Row 13: Ch 2, hdc in each st to end, turn.
Row 14: Ch 2, hdc in each of next 8 (4, 4) sts, * 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 8 (9, 9) sts, repeat from * to last 9 (5, 5) sts, 2 hdc in each of next 2 sts, hdc in each st to end, turn – 200 (210, 210) hdc.
Row 15: Ch 2, hdc in each st to end, turn.
Row 16: Ch 2, hdc in each of next 9 (5, 5) sts, * 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 9 (10, 10) sts, repeat from * to last 10 (6, 6) sts, 2 hdc in each of next 2 sts, hdc in each st to end, turn – 220 (230, 230) hdc.
Row 17: Ch 2, hdc in each st to end, turn.
Row 18: Ch 2, hdc in each of next 10 (6, 6) sts, * 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 10 (11, 11) sts, repeat from * to last 11 (7, 7) sts, 2 hdc in each of next 2 sts, hdc in each st to end, turn – 240 (250, 250) hdc.
Row 19: Ch 2, hdc in each st to end, turn.
Row 20: Ch 2, hdc in each of next 19 (7, 7) sts, * 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 19 (12, 12) sts, repeat from * to last 20 (8, 8) sts, 2 hdc in each of next 2 sts, hdc in each st to end, turn – 252 (270, 270) hdc.
For sizes L/XL and 2X/3X:
Row 21: Ch 2, hdc in each st to end, turn.
Row 22: Ch 2, hdc in each of next 7 (8) sts, * 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 14 (13) sts, repeat from * to last 7 (9) sts, 2 hdc in next 1 (2) sts, hdc in each st to end, turn – 288 (290) hdc.
For size 2X/3X only:
Row 23: Ch 2, hdc in each st across, turn.
Row 24: Ch 2, hdc in each of next 14 sts, * 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 28 sts, repeat from * to last 14 sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in each st to end, turn – 300 hdc.
For all sizes:
Fasten off.
With right facing, count 126 (144, 150) sts over and join C with slip st next st.
Begin working in the round as follows:
Round 1: Ch 2, hdc in next st and in each st around, join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2.
Work 12 rounds evenly in hdc following color chart 1. (See page 3).
Change to A and work evenly in hdc until piece measures 18 (20, 21)" (45.5 (51, 53.5) cm) from beginning.
Work 6 rounds evenly in hdc following color chart 2. (See page 3).
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Collar
With wrong side facing, join B with a slip st at first st of top edge.
Row 1 (wrong side): Ch 2, hdc in each st across, turn – 80 (90, 90) hdc.
Row 2: Ch 2, hdc in first st, * hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st, repeat from * to last st, 1 (2, 2) hdc in last st, turn – 120 (136, 136) hdc.
Rows 3 and 4: Ch 2, hdc in each st to end, turn.
Work 4 rows evenly in hdc following color chart 3. (See page 3).
Fasten off.
Tassels (make 2)
Wrap B around cardboard piece 80 times.
Cut a 6" (15 cm) length of B, slip it between the cardboard and wrapped yarn, and tie it around the wrapped yarn at one edge of the cardboard.
Remove cardboard piece.
Cut another 6" (15 cm) length of B, and tie it around entire tassel ¾" (2 cm) below first tied piece.
Cut loops open at other end of tassel, and trim ends evenly.
With B, make a chain 30" (72 cm) long.
Fasten off. Lace chain through edge sts at neck opening, then attach tassels to ends of chain.
Fringe
Cut 4 lengths of B, 10" (25.5 cm) each, and fold in half.
Using crochet hook, pull folded edge up through a bottom edge st just below a color A st (at the “point” of a color A wedge).
Pull ends through folded loop and pull to secure.
Attach a tassel in the same manner to every 3rd st along bottom edge.
Weave in all loose ends.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique™ Magical™: 2 balls 1406 Hocus Pocus.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Capelet measures 13 inches long.
gauge: 11 dc = 4 inches; 7 rows = 4 inches. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: CAPELET: Ch 39. Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook and each ch across. Rows 2-6: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, dc in each dc across.

materials: Red Heart® Boutique Unforgettable™: 2 (3) balls 3955 Winery
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8] for Child size, 6mm [US J-10] for Adult size
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Finished Neck (across top of one collar piece): 11 (13)” [28 (33) cm]; Finished Length: 15 (21)” [38 (53.5) cm]
gauge: 16 sts = 4” (10 cm); 16 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet for Child size. 14 sts = 4” (10 cm); 12 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet for Adult size.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
Dubonnet 
Poncho
Beautiful shaded yarn makes it easy to 
crochet this stunning poncho. The drapey 
style looks wonderful on all body types.
Cable Pattern 
Row 4 (right side): Ch 1, sc in first sc, *ch 3, 
skip next 2 unworked sc of Row 3, sc in next sc, 
TURN and work sc in each ch of the ch-3 just 
made, slip st in the next sc (one cable made), 
TURN; working behind the cable, sc in each of 
the 2 skipped sc; repeat from * across to last 
sc, sc in last sc of Row 3, turn—16 cables.
Note: In the next row, you will work a sc in 
the first and last st, and 3 sc evenly spaced 
behind each cable. The 3 sc behind each 
cable are worked into the sc that were worked 
into the 2 skipped sc. Work sc in one of these 
skipped sc and 2 sc into the other. Push the 
cables towards the right side of the throw as 
you work. 
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc 
in next sc; repeat from * across to last sc, sc 
in last sc, turn—50 sc.
Front Ridge Pattern
Row 6 (right side): Repeat Row 2.
Row 7: Ch 1, working in free loops of sts of 
previous row, [sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 
4 times, sc in last 10 sc, turn—54 sc.
Arrow Pattern
Row 8 (right side): Ch 2 (does not count as a 
st), dc in first st, *skip next 3 sc, tr in next sc, 
working behind tr just made, dc in each of 3 
skipped sc; repeat from * across to last st, dc 
in last st, turn—13 repeats.
Row 9: Ch 2, dc in first dc, *skip next 3 dc, tr 
in next tr, working in front of tr just made, dc 
in each of 3 skipped dc; repeat from * across 
to last st, dc in last st, turn.
Row 10: Ch 1, [sc in next 10 sts, 2 sc in next 
st] 4 times, sc in next 9 sc, sc in top of turning 
ch, turn—58 sc.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sc, [2 sc in next  
sc, sc in next 15 sc] 3 times, sc in last 5 
sc—61 sc.
Directions for Child and Adult are worked 
the same using different size hooks. 
Measurements and information are given for 
Child size with changes for Adult size are in 
parentheses.   
Finished Neck (across top of one collar 
piece): 11 (13)” [28 (33) cm]
Finished Length: 15 (21)” [38 (53.5) cm]
Notes
1. Poncho is worked from neck edge
downwards.
2. Two collar pieces are worked first, back
and forth in rows. Buttonholes are worked
across the side edges of the front collar
before front and back collars are joined at
lower corners.
3. Lower portion of poncho is worked in joined
rounds beginning around lower edge of
collar.
FRONT COLLAR
Beginning at neck edge (top), ch 41.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 5 
ch, 2 sc in next ch, *sc in next 6 ch, 2 sc in 
next ch; repeat from * across to last 5 ch, sc 
in last 5 ch, turn—45 sc.
Front Ridge Pattern
Note: Both rows of the front ridge are worked 
into the sts of the same previous row. The first 
row (Row 2) is worked into the front loops 
only. The piece is turned and the next row 
(Row 3) is worked into the free loops of the 
same row (the free loops are in the front after 
the piece is turned). 
Row 2 (right side): Ch 1, working in front 
loops only, slip st in each sc across, turn—45 
slip sts. 
Row 3: Ch 1, working in free loops of sts of 
previous row, [sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 
5 times, sc in last 5 sc, turn—50 sc.
in single crochet for Adult size. 
CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any 
size hook to obtain the gauge.
Red Heart® Boutique 
Unforgettable™, Art. 
E793 available in 
3.5oz (100 g), 280 yd 
(256 m) balls
Designed by Bonnie Barker
What you will need:
RED HEART® Boutique 
Unforgettable™: 2 (3) balls 3955 
Winery 
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 
5mm [US H-8] for Child size, 6mm 
[US J-10] for Adult size
Four 1 (1¼)” [25 (32) mm] glass 
buttons, yarn needle
GAUGE: 16 sts = 4” (10 cm); 
16 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single 
crochet for Child size. 14 sts = 
4” (10 cm); 12 rows = 4” (10 cm) 
in single crochet for Adult size.

Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
Front Ridge Pattern
Row 12 (right side): Repeat Row 2.
Row 13: Ch 1, working in free loops of sts of 
previous row, [sc in next 12 sc, 2 sc in next 
sc] 4 times, sc in last 9 sc, turn—65 sc.
Cable Pattern
Rows 14 and 15: Repeat Rows 4 and 5—21 
cables.
Front Ridge Pattern
Row 16 (right side): Ch 1, working in front 
loops only, slip st in each sc across, turn
Row 17: Ch 1, working in free loops of sts  
of previous row, sc in each sc across, turn—
65 sc.
Buttonhole Plackets
Row 1 (wrong side): Ch 1, working across 
side edge of front collar, work 17 sc evenly 
spaced across side edge, turn—17 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, ch 2, skip next 2 
sc (for buttonhole), sc in next 9 sc, ch 2, skip 
next 2 sc, sc in last 2 sc, turn—13 sc and 2 
ch-2 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, 2 sc in next ch-2 
space, sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, 
sc in last 2 sc. Fasten off. Join yarn with 
slip st in corner of other side edge and work 
buttonhole placket in same manner.
BACK COLLAR
Work same as front collar through Row 17. 
Fasten off.
Sew lower corners of side edges of front and 
back collar together. Sew buttons to side 
edges of back collar opposite buttonholes on 
front collar.
LOWER PONCHO
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing, 
join yarn with sc in side seam at lower edge of 
collar, *sc in next st (or end of row), ch 3, skip 
next st (or end of row); repeat from * around; 
join with slip st in first sc—68 ch-3 spaces.
Round 2: (Slip st, ch 3, dc) in first ch-3 space, 
ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, *ch 3, 2 dc in 
next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space; 
repeat from * around, ch 3; join with slip st in 
top of beginning ch.
Round 3: Slip st in next dc, (slip st, ch 1, sc) in 
next ch-3 space, *ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space; 
repeat from * around, ch 3; join with slip st in 
first sc.
Round 4: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in first ch-3 space, 
ch 3, 2 dc in next ch-3 space, *ch 3, sc in next 
ch-3 space, ch 3, 2 dc in next ch-3 space; 
repeat from * around, ch 3; join with slip st in 
first sc.
Round 5: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in first ch-3 space, 
*ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from *
around, ch 3; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 6: (Slip st, ch 3, 2 dc) in first ch-3
space, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, *ch 3, 3
dc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-3
space; repeat from * around, ch 3; join with
slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 7: Slip st in each dc to first ch-3 space,
(slip st, ch 1, sc) in first ch-3 space, *ch 3, sc
in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, ch
3; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 8: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in first ch-3 space,
ch 3, 3 dc in next ch-3 space, *ch 3, sc in next
ch-3 space, ch 3, 3 dc in next ch-3 space;
repeat from * around, ch 3; join with slip st in
top of beginning ch.
Rounds 9–11: Repeat Rounds 5–7.
Round 12: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in first ch-3
space, ch 3, 4 dc in next ch-3 space, *ch 3,
sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 4 dc in next ch-3
space; repeat from * around, ch 3; join with
slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 13: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in next ch-3 
space, *ch 4, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat 
from * around, ch 4; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 14: (Slip st, ch 3, 3 dc) in first ch-4 
space, ch 3, sc in next ch-4 space, *ch 3, 4 
dc in next ch-4 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-4 
space; repeat from * around, ch 3; join with 
slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 15: Slip st in each dc to first ch-3 
space, (slip st, ch 1, sc) in first ch-3 space, *ch 
4, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, 
ch 4; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 16: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in first ch-4 
space, ch 3, 4 dc in next ch-4 space, *ch 3, 
sc in next ch-4 space, ch 3, 4 dc in next ch-4 
space; repeat from * around, ch 3; join with 
slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 17: Round 13.
Round 18: (Slip st, ch 3, 4 dc) in first ch-4 
space, ch 3, sc in next ch-4 space, *ch 3, 5 
dc in next ch-4 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-4 
space; repeat from * around, ch 3; join with 
slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 19: Round 15.
Round 20: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in first ch-4 
space, ch 3, 5 dc in next ch-4 space, *ch 3, 
sc in next ch-4 space, ch 3, 5 dc in next ch-4 
space; repeat from * around, ch 4; join with slip 
st in top of beginning ch.
Round 21: Repeat Round 13.
Rounds 22 and 23: Rounds 18 and 19. 
Note: For Child Size, skip to Last Round.
Adult Size Only: Repeat Rounds 20–23.
Last Round: Ch 1, *(4 dc, ch 3, slip st in top 
of dc last dc made (picot made), 4 dc) in next 
ch-4 space, sc in next ch-4 space; repeat 
from * around; join with slip st in first dc 
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

pattern_name: Snug As A Hug Crochet Poncho
materials: Sugar Bush® Glaze™ (1.75 oz/50 g; 75 yds/68 m)
Blazing Sky (6002) 4 balls for 4/6 yrs, 6 balls for 8/10 yrs, 7 balls for XS/M, 8 balls for L/2XL
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Child 4/6 yrs 7 x 18" [18 x 45.5 cm]; Child 8/10 yrs 10 x 26" [25.5 x 66 cm]; Adult XS/M 13 x 31" [33 x 78.5 cm]; Adult L/2XL 15 x 33" [38 x 84 cm]
gauge: 3 pat reps and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to all sizes. Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc. Make 2 pieces alike Ch 36 (50-64-78) (foundation ch multiple of 7 ch + 1). 1st row: (RS). 2 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 3 dc). Skip next 3 ch. 1 sc in next ch. *Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Skip next 3 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first sc. *Skip next 3 dc. (1 sc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in is next ch-3 sp. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in the top of turning ch. Turn. Last row forms pat. Rep 2nd row 26 (33-40-42) times more. Fasten off. FINISHING Pin all pieces to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth leaving cloth to dry. Neck edging: (RS). Join yarn with sl st to back seam. Ch 1. *2 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * around neck edge. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique™ Midnight™: 3 Balls 1937 Moonlight A and 1936 Misty B.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: One size fits most. Sweater measures 28” wide x 13” long.
gauge: 12 hdc = 4”; 11 rows = 4” in. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
FRONT
With A, ch 90.
Row 1 (Right Side): Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), turn, hdc in each hdc across – 89 hdc. Fasten off.
Row 3: Join B in last st, ch 2, turn, hdc in first 2 hdc, *Fptr around next hdc 2 rows below, hdc in next 2 hdc; repeat from * to end.
Row 4: Ch 2, turn, hdc in each st to end. Fasten off.
Row 5: Join A in last st, ch 2, turn, hdc in first 2 hdc, *Fptr around next hdc 2 rows below, hdc in next 2 hdc; repeat from * to end.
Row 6: Ch 2, turn, hdc in each st to end.
Rows 7-36: Repeat Rows 2-5. 
Row 37: With A, repeat Row 2.
Row 38: Ch 2, turn, hdc in next 27 sts, ch 35, skip 33 hdc, hdc in next 27 hdc.
Row 39: Ch 2, turn, hdc in next 26 hdc, 35 hdc in ch-33 space, hdc in next 27 hdc – 89 hdc.
Row 40: Ch 2, turn, hdc in each hdc across. Fasten off.
Row 41: Join B in last st, ch 2, turn, hdc in next 4 hdc, *Fptr around next hdc 2 rows below, hdc in next 5 hdc; repeat from * to end.
Row 42: Ch 2, turn, hdc in each st across.
Rows 43-58: Repeat Rows 41-42.
Fasten off.
Row 59-76: Join A and repeat Rows 41-42.
FINISHING
With right sides together, fold piece in half lining up sts of first and last rows. Joining Row (Wrong Side): Working through both layers, ch 1, turn, sc in next 25 sts, working through sts of Row 76 only, sc in next 39 sts, working through both layers, sc in next 25 sts. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART ® “Super Saver ® ”, Art. E300, 100% Acrylic (6 ounce/348 yard multi color skein): 5 Ounces No. 310 Monet CA.
RED HEART® Ltd. “Foxy™”, Art. E724, 100% Polyester (1.76 ounce/89 yard ball): 1 Ball No. 9379 Plummy CB.
Yarn needle; one 5/8" button; sewing needle and thread.
abbreviations: CA, CB = Color A, Color B
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Poncho fits 12-18 months.
gauge: 13 sts = 4"; 17 rows = 4" in sc rows.
instructions:
PONCHO: With CA, ch 38.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, * hdc in next ch, 3 dc in next ch, hdc in next ch, sc in next ch; rep from * across; turn.
Now work in BACK LPS only unless otherwise directed.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts; 3 sc in next st – inc made; * sc in next 5 sts, inc; rep from * to last 3 sts; sc in last 3 sts; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 3 sc, * inc, sc in next 2 sc; draw up a lp in next sc, skip next sc, draw up a lp in next sc, yo and draw through all 3 lps on hook – dec made; sc in next 2 sc **; rep from * to last 2 sc, end at **; skip next sc, sc in last sc; turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sc, * inc **, sc in next 7 sc; rep from * to last 4 sc, end at **; sc in last 4 sc; turn.
Rows 5 and 6: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 4 sc, * inc, sc in next 3 sc **, dec, sc in next 3 sc; rep from * to last 2 sc, end at **; skip next sc, sc in last sc; turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sc, * inc **, sc in next 9 sc; rep from * to last 5 sc, end at **; sc in last 5 sc; JOIN with a sl st in FRONT LP of first sc of this row; TURN.
Now work in rounds, continuing to work in back lps unless otherwise directed.
Rnds 8, 9 and 10: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 5 sc, * inc, sc in next 4 sc **, dec, sc in next 4 sc; rep from * to last 2 sc, end at **; skip next sc, sc in last sc; join in front lp of first sc; turn.
Rnd 11: Ch 1, sc in first 6 sc, * inc **, sc in next 11 sc; rep from * to last 6 sc, end at **; sc in last 6 sc; join in front lp; turn.
Rnds 12, 13, and 14: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 6 sc, * inc, sc in next 5 sc **, dec, sc in next 5 sc; rep from * to last 2 sc, end at **; skip next sc, sc in last sc; join to front lp; turn.
Rnd 15: Ch 3, 2 dc in first sc, * skip next 2 sc, sc in next 4 sc, inc, sc in next 4 sc, skip next 2 sc **, 5 dc in next sc; rep from * to last st, end at **; 3 dc in last st; skip beg ch-3, join with a sl st in front lp of next dc; turn.
Rnd 16: Ch 1, 2 sc in first dc, * sc in next 2 sts, dec, sc in next 2 sts **, inc; rep from * around; sc in same st as first 2 sc of this rnd; join in front lp of first sc; turn.
Rnds 17-22: Ch 1, 2 sc in same sc as joining, * sc in next 2 sc, dec, sc in next 2 sc **, inc; rep from * around, end at **; sc in same st as first 2 sc; join in front lp; turn.
Rnd 23: Ch 1, 2 sc in same sc as joining, * sc in next 7 sc **, inc; rep from * around, end at **; sc in same sc as first 2 sc; join in front lp changing to CB; turn.
Rnd 24: With CB, ch 1, 2 sc in same sc as joining, * sc in next 3 sc, dec, sc in next 3 sc **, inc; rep from * around, end at **; sc in same sc as first 2 sc; join in both lps of first sc; do NOT turn.
Rnd 25-Work all in BOTH lps: Ch 1, inc in first sc, * sc in next 3 sc, dec, sc in next 3 sc **, inc; rep from * around, end at **; join. Fasten off.
HOOD: Beg at face edge with CA, ch 56. Work all sts in both lps.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 55 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Rows 3 and 4: Rep Row 2
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, skip next sc, sc in each sc to last 2 sc; skip next sc, sc in last sc; turn – 53 sc.
Rep Rows 3-5 three more times – 47 sc. Work even in sc until 4" from beg.
Shape Crown: Ch 1, sc in first 22 sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc, skip next sc, sc in last 22 sc; turn – 45 sc. Work 1 row even. Next Row: Ch 1, sc in first 21 sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc, skip next sc, sc in last 21 sc; turn – 43 sc.
Shape Back: Sl st in first 3 sc, ch 1, sc in next 37 sc; turn. Next Row: Sl st in first 3 sc, ch 1, sc in next 14 sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc, skip next sc, sc in next 14 sc; turn – 29 sc. Next Row: Sl st in first 3 sc, ch 1, sc in next 23 sc; turn. Next Row: Sl st in first 3 sc, ch 1, sc in next 7 sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc, skip next sc, sc in next 7 sc – 15 sc. Fasten off.
Sew back seam. Sew hood to neck edge. Edging: With right side facing, attach CA at seam at left neck edge; ch 1, work sc evenly down left opening and up right opening to seam; ch 9 for button loop; sl st in same place as last sc. Fasten off.
Hood Edging: With right side facing, attach CB at seam at right neck edge; ch 1, sc in each st of beg ch of hood; turn. Work 1 more row sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Sew button to left neck edge.

materials: RED HEART® Baby Hugs™ Medium: 1 ball each 4830 Pool A, 4001 Frosting B, and 4410 Dolphin C
Susan Bates® split lock stitch markers
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Circumference at top: 20” (51 cm); Circumference at bottom: 40 (42, 44, 46)” (101.5 (106.5, 112, 117) cm); Length: 12 (13½, 15, 16½)” (30.5 (34, 38, 42) cm)
gauge: 12 dc = 4” (10 cm); 8½ dc rows = 4” (10 cm) when worked in Camel stitch (see Notes). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Poncho is worked from the bottom up in joined rounds with the right side always facing. All stitches are worked through the back loop and the third loop (the strand below the back loop, also known as Camel stitch). To change color, work last stitch of old color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new color and draw through all loops on hook to complete stitch. Proceed with new color.

SPECIAL STITCHES
dc2tog = [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] twice, yarn over, draw through all loops on hook

COLOR SEQUENCE
4 rounds with C
2 rounds with B
[1 round with A (C, A, C)
2 rounds with B
1 round with C (A, C, A)
2 rounds with B ] 3 (3, 4, 4) times
0 (1, 0, 1) round with A (C, A, C)
0 (2, 0, 2) rounds with B
1 round with A
1 round with B
1 round (edging) with C
- 26 (29, 32, 35) rounds total

PONCHO
With A, ch 120 (126, 132, 138), join with a slip st to the first ch to work in the round.
Change colors as you work following the Color Sequence above.

Round 1: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), dc in each ch around, join with slip st in beg dc.

Next 5 (8, 11, 14) rounds: Ch 2, dc in each dc around, join with slip st in beg dc.

Next round (dec round): Ch 2, dc in each of first 28 (30, 31, 33) dc), [dc2tog over next 2 dc] twice and mark the 2 dc2tog just made, dc in each of next 56 (58, 62, 64) dc, [dc2tog over next 2 dc] twice and mark the 2 dc2tog just made, dc in each dc to end of round – 116 (122, 128, 134) sts.
** Work 2 rounds evenly.

Next round (dec round): * Ch 2, dc in each dc to 3 sts before marked st, [dc2tog over next 2 dc] 4 times and mark the center 2 dc2tog of the 4 just made; repeat from * once more, dc in each dc to end of round – 108 (114, 120, 126) sts.

Repeat from ** twice more – 92 (98, 104, 110) sts.

Remove all markers.
Work 3 (3, 3, 1) rounds evenly.

** Next round (dec round): Place 8 (10, 11, 10) markers evenly spaced around previous round, ch 2, * dc in each dc to marked st, dc2tog over next 2 sts, remove marker; repeat from * 7 (9, 10, 9) more times, dc in each dc to end of round, join with slip st in beg dc – 84 (88, 93, 100) sts.

Work 1 round evenly.
Repeat from ** 2 (2, 2, 3) more times – 68 (68, 71, 70) sts.

Next round (dec round): Place 8 (8, 11, 10) markers evenly spaced around previous round, ch 2, * dc in each dc to marked st, dc2tog over next 2 sts, remove marker; repeat from * 7 (7, 10, 9) more times, dc in each dc to end of round, join with slip st in beg dc – 60 sts.

Last round (edging): Ch 1, sc in each st around, join with a slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.

FLOWER EMBELLISHMENTS
Choose points in the poncho where you want to add a flower. Join yarn with a slip st around the post of the dc where the rightmost petal will be, (ch 3, 3 dc, ch 3, slip st) around that same post, turn work 90 degrees, (slip st, ch 3, 3 dc, ch 3, slip st) in space between dc sts on row above, turn work 90 degrees, (slip st, ch 3, 3 dc, ch 3, slip st) around post of next dc, turn work 90 degrees (slip st, ch 3, 3 dc, ch 3, slip st) in space between dc sts on row below.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Weave in all loose ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 3 (4, 4) skeins 312 Black A
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6 mm [US J-10]
Susan Bates® split lock stitch markers
Extra hooks in neighboring sizes (see notes)
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Poncho measures 27 (31, 35)" (68.5 (78.5, 89) cm) along any edge, and 38¼ (43¾, 49¼)" (97 (111, 125) cm) across wingspan at widest point.
gauge: 13 sts (including ch sts) = 4" (10 cm); 13 rows = 4" (10 cm) in Moss Stitch. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
MOSS STITCH
Ch an even number of sts.
Row 1: Sk 3 ch, sc in next ch, * ch 1, skip 1 foundation ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * to end, turn.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as a stitch now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-3 space, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2 (counts as a stitch now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Repeat Row 3 only for Moss st.
PONCHO
Color-Pooled Trim
With B, ch through at least one full color sequence, with the last loop on hook being the first loop of a new color just after a color change in the yarn. 
Row 1 (right side): Skip 3 ch, sc in the 4th ch from the hook, * ch 1, sc around the foundation ch (instead of going into a ch st); repeat from * until 1 full color sequence has been completed on this row. Leave remaining ch sts unworked. Count the number of sc made in each color. Undo one st repeat (sc, ch 1), turn. 
Row 2 (wrong side): Ch 2 (counts as a stitch now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-3 space, turn. Note: As you work this row and all remaining rows, you MUST get the correct color st in the correct place in order to maintain the planned color pooling. Change hook sizes, or actual st used, to get the correct color in place. If you use the same number of sts per color that you counted on Row 1, it will work out. 
Row 3 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as a stitch now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in the next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end, finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn. The color of the sts on this row will shift to the left by 1 st from the previous right side row if right handed; it will shift to the right by 1 st if left handed.
Row 4 (wrong side): Ch 2, sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in the next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end, finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn. The color of the sts on this row will shift to the left by 1 st from the previous wrong side row if right handed; it will shift to the right by 1 st if left handed. 
Repeat Rows 3 and 4 until Trim measures 54 (62, 70)" (137 (157.5, 178) cm), ending on a Row 3 (right side row). Change to color A on last stitch of final row, work row 4 once more. Fasten off. 
1st FINISHIING
With right side of trim facing and working across the foundation chain edge, join A with a slip st in ch-3 edge space, ch 2, sc in next space between sc of row 1, * ch 1, sc in next space between sc of row 1; repeat from * to end of edge, place a stitch marker in loop on hook to secure it, remove hook. Squish or stretch the sts on foundation chain of Trim to match the width of the rest of the Trim. You can slide the sts around along the foundation chain, as with an adjustable ring. Once in place, remove marker from loop and place loop back on hook. Slip st into the chain next to the last sc of row 1. Fasten off. Unravel unused foundation ch sts and weave in yarn tail to secure foundation chain sts. 
Measure the average gauge of the Trim. At this point it is more important for the Body gauge to match the Trim gauge than the gauge listed in this pattern. 
Body
With right facing and working across one long side edge of Trim, join A with slip st in ch-2 edge space of the last completed row. 
Row 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as a stitch now and throughout), sc in next ch-2 edge space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-2 edge space; repeat from * to end of long edge of Trim, turn.
Row 2 (wrong side): Ch 2 (counts as a stitch now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Repeat Row 2 only until entire piece (including trim) measures 27 (31, 35)" (68.5 (78.5, 89) cm). Fasten off. 
Foldover Collar
Place a marker on either side of center 20 (22, 24)" (51 (56, 61) cm) of last row in a ch-1 space.
With right side facing, join A with slip st at first marker, ch 2, and work in established Moss st to second marker.
Continue in established Moss st across center 20 (22, 24)" (51 (56, 61) cm) only until collar measures 10 (11, 12)" (25.5 (28, 30.5) cm).
Fasten off. 
2nd FINISHIING
Seaming
